Of the 15+ bitcoin wallets I have tested, this is one of the easiest to use for beginners. My major complaint (and really my only complaint) about this wallet is that it lacks a \"Max\" button when sending bitcoins.  From the send Bitcoin view, there is no way to view your current balance or to set the application to send every possible bitcoin to a new location.  For day to day use, this is not a huge problem, but it is a problem when you are testing multiple systems or when you decide to cash out of bitcoin altogether.  I have now closed and deleted at least two Bitcoin Wallet applications that have between 0.00000001 BTC and 0.000100 BTC still unspent. With the private keys now gone, these coins are \"lost\" forever and can never be spent by anyone. This app could use a password entry encrypting the private keys, forcing the password to be entered to allow spending or new address generating. That'd give me the chance to get back home and restore a backup and send btc out of the Android Bitcoin Wallet so that the person who stole my device would never get my btc that was stored in it.
